data.title: Staging dirty new or existing file removes dirty editor
data.body: ...what the schleck?

data.title: Replace mode needs more UX affordance
data.body:
#8184

Currently the search / replace widget behaves quite differently if the replace box is visible or not. The differences are what results are outlined in the viewlet (searched or replaced) and what file is opened when you click on a result.
There is a large difference in behavior and the only way a user can see in what mode he is is whether a replace box is visible. I propose to add some more UX affordance - maybe updating the title of SEARCH to SEARCH / REPLACE. Or some more styling with colors.
This might get fixed by addressing #8286

ping @stevencl, @bpasero  for opinions

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:

1.  search / replace for some term
2.  look at the changes one by one, notice how we have these nice global action show next / previos change
3. it would be cool if the replace all in file action would also be present there

data.title: Problems: double click on problem should pin the editor
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7601

Same as explorer and search. There is an editor option "pinned: true" you can use.

data.title: Uninstalling an extension should notify the user that a VSCode restart is required
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8215:
- install extension 'mock-debug'
- create a launch config and a readme.md file with some lines of text
- start debugging

Observe: you should be able to step through the lines of the readme.md file
- from the extension viewlet uninstall 'mock-debug'
- start debugging

Observe: you get an error message that some *.js file is missing

Expected behaviour: after removing the extension, the debug type 'mock' should no longer be defined and the error message should say so.

Since a reload window fixes that, I suggest to always reload after an uninstall (the same as on install).

data.title: Replace tree refresh feels a bit slugish
data.body:
#8184

Just the impression I got - so feel free to close

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search  / replace for some term
2. Remove results one by one (not by file, but by result)
3. The whole tree update feels a bit slow to me
4. You should refresh just that node in the tree (the file) - not the whole tree in this case. Not sure if you are doing that

data.title: Problems: pressing ESC in filter box should clear filter box
data.body:
Refs: #7601

Similar to how the extensions viewlet filter box does it.

data.title: activationEvents.workspaceContains for directories
data.body: I'm currently creating an extension for Meteor. I only want to activate it if the workspace contains a Meteor project. For that I would like to check for the presence of a `.meteor` directory.

data.title: Tab title background should not be current line highlight
data.body:
This is a unhappy collision of styles (GitHub Clean White theme) and the background color of the tab area. I wonder if we should use the background color of viewlets inside of the darker tone?

data.title: Replace all button disabled when search box has focus
data.body:
#8184
1. Search / replace for something
2. Notice how the replace button inside the replace box is disabled only if the search input has focus
3. I find this quite weird and I would expect that this button is always enabled

data.title: No variable substitution for env
data.body:
re #8196

```
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development",
                "foo": "${command.PickProcess}",
                "rnd": "${command.rnd}"
            },
```

and see how `foo` and `rnd` are not replaced with the values

data.title: Replace vs search background color difference too subtle
data.body:
#8184

Steps to Reproduce:
1. I like how we use a different background color in the search box depending if we show search results or replaced results
2. However the color difference is very subtle - it should be much more prominent IMHO
3. You just change the transparency by 0.15 - maybe increase this, and also you might need different change based on light / dark theme

data.title: Keyboard accessibility: Ability to set the variable value by pressing Enter on the variable
data.body: When navigating variable tree using keyboard, it would be useful to allow setting the value by pressing Enter or some other appropriate key

data.title: Global replace all not very accessible
data.body:
#8184
1. Currently using the keyboard you can do the global find replace by pressing shit + tab
2. I have concerns that this is not very discoverable for people that use accessibility
3. I propose we introduce a global workbench command which would just open the search viewlet and toggle the replace box.

data.title: Markdown: default markdown.styles should not be null

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7945

data.title: Editor zoom sometimes acts too early and needs a way to get out
data.body:
I am not sure how but I am often triggering the new editor zoom with the mouse and then I am in a state where I don't even know how to restore the editor back to normal state.

For one, I think we should show something prominent in the status bar when you zoomed like that and when you click you get back to default zoom.

Then, maybe we should be smarter when to trigger the zooming: E.g. I might have accidentally pressed Ctrl/Cmd and triggered mouse wheel. On Mac this can happen even easier because of the track pad.

In the end a setting might also need to just turn it off.

data.title: default launch.json talks about 'action.PickProcess'
data.body:
re #8196

I find this `"processId": "${action.PickProcess}",` in my launch.json but I the it should be `command.PickProcess`

data.title: Open editors list jumps after selecting an editor in the list
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn tabs on
2. Open multiple editors in three editor groups
3. Select an editor in the left or the right group
4. Click on one of the editors in the centre group
   Expected: the editor to be selected and the list to remain static
   Actual: the editor is selected but the list moves so that the selected item is no longer under the mouse

I found this quite hard to repro. I noticed it happen occasionally but each time it happened I couldn't easily make it happen again. The above steps are the best repro steps I could find. 

If you have to scroll the list of open editors so that the centre group becomes visible, it doesn't repro so easily.

This was found while testing Drag and Drop editors and tabs #7852 but is not about drag and drop.

data.title: Extension UI: don't apply themes to extension description
data.body:
for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8215:

Since the Marketplace doesn't support themes, all extension descriptions where 'designed' with the default light theme in mind.

Applying other themes to an extension description make them look bad. 

We should consider whether we really want to apply themes here.

data.title: Markdown: hand cursor showing up in editor
data.body:
Using the following markdown:

```

```
